intro: Hepetis pulverulenta, commonly known as the dustflower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family, which includes many bell-shaped flowers. The plant produces small, pale blue to white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded woodland areas. The foliage is characterized by narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are slightly hairy.
